events.body: The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers. ### Code Coverage & Benchmarks For details see: https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/34303. ### Reviews See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process. | Type | Reviewers | | ---- | --------- | | ACK | [stratospher](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34303#pullrequestreview-3677842487) | | Concept ACK | [fjahr](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34303#issuecomment-3754423719), [w0xlt](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34303#issuecomment-3757543188) | If your review is incorrectly listed, please copy-paste <!--meta-tag:bot-skip--> into the comment that the bot should ignore.

events.message:
test: addrman: test self-announcement time penalty handling

Verify that addresses announcing themselves (addr == source) are exempt
from time penalties, while addresses announced by others receive the
expected penalty.

events.body: left another nit. Feel free to ignore.

comments.body: Could those use exact checks, when using SetMockTime to pin the time?

```suggestion
    SetMockTime(Now<NodeSeconds>());
```

nit: Could remove the hard-coded constant here, and the hard-coded check below?

```
    BOOST_CHECK(base_time.time_since_epoch() == 12335678s);
```

Which seems like a self-test  of the chrono utils?
